comments.creator: gmierz2@outlook.com

comments.text: Hm, could this be a regression from https://hg.mozilla.org/integration/autoland/rev/72f6e2d07667?
comments.creator: hskupin@gmail.com
comments.author: hskupin@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: Hm, could this be a regression from https://hg.mozilla.org/integration/autoland/rev/72f6e2d07667?

I had another look and it's indeed the change from `public/build` to `public/`. Until now I never got a reply from Tom, why that was necessary. Let me ask that on the other bug. And I think that this patch was wrong, because builds have to exist under `public/build`.
comments.creator: hskupin@gmail.com
comments.author: hskupin@gmail.com
comments.text: I had another look and it's indeed the change from `public/build` to `public/`. Until now I never got a reply from Tom, why that was necessary. Let me ask that on the other bug. And I think that this patch was wrong, because builds have to exist under `public/build`.

comments.raw_text: Ah ok thanks, if this could be fixed on the mozilla-central side that would be ideal
comments.author: gmierz2@outlook.com
comments.creator: gmierz2@outlook.com
comments.text: Ah ok thanks, if this could be fixed on the mozilla-central side that would be ideal

comments.creator: mozilla@hocat.ca
comments.text:
Created attachment 9150911
Bug 1639955: Use  prefix for geckodriver toolchain artifacts; r?aki

We originally switched it to use just `public/` becuase iscript broke with the
extra path, but that broke out-of-tree consumers. Now that iscript is fixed,
switch it back.
comments.raw_text:
We originally switched it to use just `public/` becuase iscript broke with the
extra path, but that broke out-of-tree consumers. Now that iscript is fixed,
switch it back.
